title: owncloud 5: contacts via carddav are still read-only
body:
### expected behaviour
when adding or modifying a contact via carddav it should not give an error message but upload the changes to owncloud.

### actual behaviour
adding/modifying a contact via carddav leads to an error message "400 - bad request".

### steps to reproduce
1. create an owncloud user
2. connect to addressbook using evolution or carddav client on android
3. add or modify a contact

### server configuration
operating system: 3.8.13-gentoo

web server: apache/2.2.25 (unix)

database: sqlite

php version: 5.5.2-pl0-gentoo

owncloud version: 5.0.9 and 5.0.10

### client configuration
browser: web interface works; carddav seems to be broken: evolution and android carddav client

operating system: ubuntu precise 12.04

### logs
#### web server error log

[ip] - [server] [06/sep/2013:10:45:25 +0200] "propfind /owncloud-5.0.10/remote.php/carddav/addressbooks/[user]/contacts/ http/1.1" 207 619
[ip] - [server] [06/sep/2013:10:45:25 +0200] "get /owncloud-5.0.10/remote.php/carddav/addressbooks/[user]/contacts/3708563828.vcf http/1.1" 200 153
[ip] - [server] [06/sep/2013:10:45:29 +0200] "propfind /owncloud-5.0.10/remote.php/carddav/addressbooks/[user]/contacts/ http/1.1" 207 619
[ip] - [server] [06/sep/2013:10:45:29 +0200] "put /owncloud-5.0.10/remote.php/carddav/addressbooks/[user]/contacts/3708563828.vcf http/1.1" 400 272
[ip]  - - [06/sep/2013:10:45:48 +0200] "post /owncloud-5.0.10/index.php/heartbeat http/1.1" 200 -
